oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A new classification for thermal development of fluid flow in a circular tube under laminar forced convection
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHULIKAR, SP
TSO, CP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: heat-transfer
microchannels
thermal development
laminar fluid flow
forced convection
circular tube flow
microchannel cooling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: By re-examining the general criterion for thermal development of fluid flow in a circular tube under laminar forced convection, it is possible to define a thermal development ratio, which leads to the identification of four different conditions of flow within the laminar regime. These different flow conditions subsequently lead to 12 possible ways of classifying changes in the thermal development of flow. Central to the concept is the proposed universally applicable description of thermal undevelopment of flow. The refined classification is shown to better describe several practical cases encountered in heat transfer applications, as well as in fluid flow near a changing boundary.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PROCEEDINGS OF THE ROYAL SOCIETY OF LONDON SERIES A-MATHEMATICAL PHYSICAL AND ENGINEERING SCIENCES, 458(2019), 669-682
